column4: when apt-get tries to install java...it wants me to agree to it in the "SHOW DETAILS" window
how do i enter that window to agree to it
Open it up by clicking the little arrow next to it
In the little window that comes up and shows you the installation progress
How are you installing this?
Adept may be a little different in the layout.  #kubuntu could tell you more concretely.  Or you can just do this via the command line,
You should ask in #kubuntu, I don't know.
you mean bluez-audio?
You were asked a question, you haven't answered.  Also, people in here are volunteers.
I did
Are you sure there was one?
Ah, well, you're asking in a rather horrible fashion.  Its a card?  Whats the card model?
Thats what you *should* be asking about.  Support for ATI tv wonder aydda yadda
Again, it doesn't quite work that way.
Stop being annoying and rude.  You're being helped. Stop being stupid
Like I said, it *doesn't* work like that.  You don't necessarily have a driver for that particular chip on the board.  Calm the hell down, and be patient.
fine.  Find it yourself.
It didn't stop being used.  Its not in the stable kernel yet.
